intro: Cardamine tepelenensis, commonly known as the Tepelenë watercress, is a small, herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of the Balkans. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other cruciferous plants. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as stream banks and forest floors. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a peppery taste, similar to other members of its family. It is characterized by its small white or pale yellow flowers that appear in early spring.
